title: Replication data for: Mental Budgeting versus Relative Thinking
creator: Samuel Hirshman
description: In many situations, mental budgeting and relative thinking predict results that are in opposing directions. We study a situation of this type and provide evidence for when the predictions of one model will dominate the other.
subject: D12 Consumer Economics: Empirical Analysis
D91 Micro-Based Behavioral Economics: Role and Effects of Psychological, Emotional, Social, and Cognitive Factors on Decision Making
